overview:
Julia Zamorska, VP of Corporate Communications iolo technologies, LLC Los Angeles, California, USA

As VP of corporate communications at iolo technologies, a 14-year-old PC performance software company with more than 40 million users worldwide, Julia Zamorska supervises all of the company’s external and internal communications efforts, managing the internal public relations department and eight agencies and distributors across 40 countries. Prior to joining iolo technologies in 2008, Ms. Zamorska worked at Ruder Finn, an international public relations agency, where she managed campaigns for several technology companies including Specific Media and Interpolls. She started her career at Antenna Group, a boutique public relations agency in San Francisco, managing public relations campaigns for clients including Jigsaw, MyNewPlace and MyBizHomepage.

In 2011, Zamorska was honored as “Executive of the Year” in the 8th annual Stevie Awards for Women in Business and named to the high-profile “15 to Watch” list of up-and-coming public relations stars by PR News. Her department was named as one of only five Finalists for “Communications Department of the Year” in The 2011 American Business Awards, and won Bronze in that category in 2012. Her employees frequently receive individual awards, including from HPRA’s PRemio Awards, and in 2011 iolo technology’s monthly internal newsletter received a PRSA-LA PRism award, PR News’ Platinum PR award, and The Holmes Report’s SABRE award.

Born and raised in Poland, Ms. Zamorska has lived in six countries and is fluent in English and Polish, with a working knowledge of German and Italian. Ms. Zamorska holds a Bachelor of Arts in social science (summa cum laude) from University College Utrecht, Netherlands, having also spent two semesters at University of California in Berkeley. She also holds a Master of Science degree in social anthropology from Oxford University, England.
